title: Claude Code 2.1.0 Release
description: Major release featuring MCP Tool Search with lazy loading for AI tools, 16 new changes including faster startup performance, multilingual support, LSP tool for code intelligence, /terminal-setup command, clickable [Image #N] links, showTurnDuration feature, and UI improvements.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Code just got updated with one of the most-requested user features

title: CLI Agent Modes and Cloud Handoff
description: Introduction of Plan and Ask agent modes to the Cursor CLI, support for background tasks with cloud handoff capabilities, word-level inline diffs, and one-click MCP authentication.

community_feedback.quote: WOW. the planning mode of cursor is great
I have Cursor subscription but I don't use the IDE anymore, just the CLI

title: Copilot CLI: Enhanced Agents and Context Management
description: Enhanced agents and context management for GitHub Copilot CLI, with new ways to install Copilot CLI and continued improvements to terminal-native workflows.

community_feedback.quote: GitHub Copilot CLI shipped smarter agents and better context

title: GPT-5.2-Codex Integration
description: GPT-5.2-Codex is now available in Windsurf, featuring multiple reasoning effort levels (low, medium, high, xhigh) and limited-time discounts on credit usage. OpenAI's most capable agentic coding model for complex, real-world software engineering.

community_feedback.quote: The latest update fixed a lot of issues with GPT 5.2 Codex

title: Windsurf Editor Version 1.13.9
description: Improvements to GPT-5.2-Codex harness and Windows Group Policy support for admins to manage Windsurf restrictions.

title: Devin Review - AI Code Review Tool
description: Launch of Devin Review, a new AI-powered code review interface that transforms complex GitHub PRs into organized diffs with smart grouping, detects moved or renamed code, provides clear explanations and bug detection.

community_feedback.quote: We also used Devin as an AI code review tool. Reviews were great, it actually left meaningful comments, not high level nonsense.
My initial thoughts on Devin Review - basically a free code review tool that makes GitHub PRs easier to comprehend

title: v3 API: Enterprise Endpoint
description: Added new enterprise endpoint GET /v3beta1/enterprise/metrics/active-users for retrieving unique active user data, enhancing enterprise analytics capabilities.

title: Version v1.5.34 Release
description: Added shareable agents feature allowing generation of publicly shareable links, and introduced new code review inbox functionality.

title: Version v0.26.0-preview.0 and Conductor Extension
description: Latest preview release featuring Conductor extension for structured, context-driven AI-assisted operations, enhanced telemetry with Google Cloud integration, and improved interactivity for running complex terminal commands.

title: No January 2026 Updates
description: Aider did not have any specific product updates or releases in January 2026. Latest official updates were from August 2025 (v0.86.0). However, Aider was prominently featured in multiple 'Best AI Coding Assistants' lists published in January 2026.

title: Version 0.88.0: Headless Device-Code Authentication
description: Device-code auth is now available as a standalone fallback for headless environments, improving authentication workflows for CI/CD and server deployments.
